channel.title: Is FindRoadColor currently broken?
channel.description:
Hi all,
I've searched the forums and google and found a post on another forum stating that SCAR 3.20 broke the FindRoadColor function. That doesn't make too much sense to me~ I'd expect a RS update to break it, not a SCAR update. But I was hoping for confirmation if updates have, in fact, broken the FindRoadColor function.
Background: I leeched a script for mining ore that worked pretty darn well. Based on tutorials and my dated c++ knowledge, I then wrote a separate routine for testing purposes which based on bitmaps, once near a statue in north Falador, allow me to flawlessly (so far) find the smelter and smelt. That might sound miniscule, but for me it was a big step! :) I then started a test script using radial walks to transit from the furnace to the mining site, just to see if I could do it... but using FindRoadColor never works. By manually eyedropping the color I brought success to around 5-10% per roadwalk, but still nothing near what's needed for the long transit. I was hoping that by using FindRoadColor or FindFaladorRoadColor I could make a more reliable script. I could, I suppose, use bitmaps at road intersections, but I'm afraid that would be more predictable, and therefore more detectable by Jagex. I can post my scripts, but they are not properly credited yet.

item.title: Is FindRoadColor currently broken?
item.dc:creator: @yimboli yimboli
item.description:
@yimboli wrote:

Thanks. I found the post (saying FindRoadColor was broken) on a cached google page of villavu, since the forums were not accessible the last couple days. Looks like they’re back up now

Read full topic

item.title: Is FindRoadColor currently broken?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You might wanna repost this over on the SRL Forum (villavu.com) if you didn’t already, the SCAR headz are way more active over there than they are here.

Read full topic
